trans-unit.target: There is also a Premium option that you can pay a little more for so you can have your own dedicated server underneath.

trans-unit.source: With the Standard option, the database runs on shared hardware, which can throttle your database queries if you happen to be on a particularly busy server.
trans-unit.target: With the Standard option, the database runs on shared hardware, which can throttle your database queries if you happen to be on a particularly busy server.

trans-unit.source: Scenarios for SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Scenarios for SQL Database

trans-unit.source: If you're creating an Azure application (using any of the compute models) that needs relational storage, SQL Database can be a good option.
trans-unit.target: If you're creating an Azure application (using any of the compute models) that needs relational storage, SQL Database can be a good option.

trans-unit.source: Applications running outside the cloud can also use this service, though, so there are plenty of other scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Applications running outside the cloud can also use this service, though, so there are plenty of other scenarios.

trans-unit.source: For instance, data stored in SQL Database can be accessed from different client systems, including desktops, laptops, tablets, and phones.
trans-unit.target: For instance, data stored in SQL Database can be accessed from different client systems, including desktops, laptops, tablets, and phones.

trans-unit.source: And because it provides built-in high availability through replication, using SQL Database can help minimize downtime.
trans-unit.target: And because it provides built-in high availability through replication, using SQL Database can help minimize downtime.

trans-unit.source: Tables
trans-unit.target: Tables

trans-unit.source: Azure Storage Tables
trans-unit.target: Azure Storage Tables

trans-unit.source: Figure: Azure Tables provides a flat NoSQL way to store data.
trans-unit.target: Figure: Azure Tables provides a flat NoSQL way to store data.

trans-unit.source: This feature is sometimes called different terms as it's part of a larger feature called "Azure Storage".
trans-unit.target: This feature is sometimes called different terms as it's part of a larger feature called "Azure Storage".

trans-unit.source: If you see "tables", "Azure tables" or "storage tables", it's all the same thing.
trans-unit.target: If you see "tables", "Azure tables" or "storage tables", it's all the same thing.

trans-unit.source: And don't be confused by the name: this technology doesn't provide relational storage.
trans-unit.target: And don't be confused by the name: this technology doesn't provide relational storage.

trans-unit.source: In fact, it's an example of a NoSQL approach called a key/value store.
trans-unit.target: In fact, it's an example of a NoSQL approach called a key/value store.

trans-unit.source: Azure Tables let an application store properties of various types, such as strings, integers, and dates.
trans-unit.target: Azure Tables let an application store properties of various types, such as strings, integers, and dates.

trans-unit.source: An application can then retrieve a group of properties by providing a unique key for that group.
trans-unit.target: An application can then retrieve a group of properties by providing a unique key for that group.

trans-unit.source: While complex operations like joins aren't supported, tables offer fast access to typed data.
trans-unit.target: While complex operations like joins aren't supported, tables offer fast access to typed data.

trans-unit.source: They're also very scalable, with a single table able to hold as much as a terabyte of data.
trans-unit.target: They're also very scalable, with a single table able to hold as much as a terabyte of data.

trans-unit.source: And matching their simplicity, tables are usually less expensive to use than SQL Database's relational storage.
trans-unit.target: And matching their simplicity, tables are usually less expensive to use than SQL Database's relational storage.

trans-unit.source: Scenarios for Tables
trans-unit.target: Scenarios for Tables

trans-unit.source: Suppose you want to create an Azure application that needs fast access to typed data, maybe lots of it, but doesn't need to perform complex SQL queries on this data.
trans-unit.target: Suppose you want to create an Azure application that needs fast access to typed data, maybe lots of it, but doesn't need to perform complex SQL queries on this data.

trans-unit.source: For example, imagine you're creating a consumer application that needs to store customer profile information for each user.
trans-unit.target: For example, imagine you're creating a consumer application that needs to store customer profile information for each user.

trans-unit.source: Your app is going to be very popular, so you need to allow for lots of data, but you won't do much with this data beyond storing it, then retrieving it in simple ways.
trans-unit.target: Your app is going to be very popular, so you need to allow for lots of data, but you won't do much with this data beyond storing it, then retrieving it in simple ways.

trans-unit.source: This is exactly the kind of scenario where Azure Tables makes sense.
trans-unit.target: This is exactly the kind of scenario where Azure Tables makes sense.

trans-unit.source: Blobs
trans-unit.target: Blobs

trans-unit.source: ![Azure Storage Blobs](./media/fundamentals-introduction-to-azure/StorageBlobsIntroNew.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure Storage Blobs](./media/fundamentals-introduction-to-azure/StorageBlobsIntroNew.png)

trans-unit.source: Figure: Azure Blobs provides unstructured binary data.
trans-unit.target: Figure: Azure Blobs provides unstructured binary data.

trans-unit.source: Azure Blobs (again "Blob Storage" and just "Storage Blobs" are the same thing) is designed to store unstructured binary data.
trans-unit.target: Azure Blobs (again "Blob Storage" and just "Storage Blobs" are the same thing) is designed to store unstructured binary data.

trans-unit.source: Like Tables, Blobs provides inexpensive storage, and a single blob can be as large as 1TB (one terabyte).
trans-unit.target: Like Tables, Blobs provides inexpensive storage, and a single blob can be as large as 1TB (one terabyte).

trans-unit.source: Azure applications can also use Azure drives, which let blobs provide persistent storage for a Windows file system mounted in an Azure instance.
trans-unit.target: Azure applications can also use Azure drives, which let blobs provide persistent storage for a Windows file system mounted in an Azure instance.

trans-unit.source: The application sees ordinary Windows files, but the contents are actually stored in a blob.
trans-unit.target: The application sees ordinary Windows files, but the contents are actually stored in a blob.

trans-unit.source: Blob storage is used by many other Azure features (including Virtual Machines), so it can certainly handle your workloads too.
trans-unit.target: Blob storage is used by many other Azure features (including Virtual Machines), so it can certainly handle your workloads too.

trans-unit.source: Scenarios for Blobs
trans-unit.target: Scenarios for Blobs

trans-unit.source: An application that stores video, massive files, or other binary information can use blobs for simple, cheap storage.
trans-unit.target: An application that stores video, massive files, or other binary information can use blobs for simple, cheap storage.

trans-unit.source: Blobs are also commonly used in conjunction with other services like Content Delivery Network, which we will talk about later.
trans-unit.target: Blobs are also commonly used in conjunction with other services like Content Delivery Network, which we will talk about later.

trans-unit.source: Import / Export
trans-unit.target: Import / Export

trans-unit.source: Azure Import Export Service
trans-unit.target: Azure Import Export Service

trans-unit.source: Figure: Azure Import / Export provides the ability to ship a physical hard drive to or from Azure for faster and cheaper bulk data import or export.
trans-unit.target: Figure: Azure Import / Export provides the ability to ship a physical hard drive to or from Azure for faster and cheaper bulk data import or export.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes you want to move a lot of data into Azure.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes you want to move a lot of data into Azure.

trans-unit.source: That would take a long time, perhaps days, and use a lot of bandwidth.
trans-unit.target: That would take a long time, perhaps days, and use a lot of bandwidth.

trans-unit.source: In these cases you can use Azure Import/Export, which allows you to ship Bitlocker-encrypted 3.5" SATA hard drives directly to Azure data centers, where Microsoft will transfer the data into blob storage for you.
trans-unit.target: In these cases you can use Azure Import/Export, which allows you to ship Bitlocker-encrypted 3.5" SATA hard drives directly to Azure data centers, where Microsoft will transfer the data into blob storage for you.

trans-unit.source: After the upload is completed, Microsoft ships the drives back to you.
trans-unit.target: After the upload is completed, Microsoft ships the drives back to you.

trans-unit.source: You can also request that large amounts of data from Blob Storage be exported onto hard drives and sent back to you via mail.
trans-unit.target: You can also request that large amounts of data from Blob Storage be exported onto hard drives and sent back to you via mail.

trans-unit.source: Scenarios for Import / Export
trans-unit.target: Scenarios for Import / Export

trans-unit.source: **Large Data Migration** - Anytime you have large amounts of data (Terabytes) that you want to upload to Azure, the Import/Export service is often much faster and perhaps cheaper than transferring it over the internet.
trans-unit.target: **Large Data Migration** - Anytime you have large amounts of data (Terabytes) that you want to upload to Azure, the Import/Export service is often much faster and perhaps cheaper than transferring it over the internet.

trans-unit.source: Once the data is in blobs, you can process it into other forms such as Table storage or an SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Once the data is in blobs, you can process it into other forms such as Table storage or an SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: **Archived Data Recovery** - You can use Import/Export to have Microsoft transfer large amounts of data stored in Azure Blob Storage to a storage device that you send and then have that device delivered back to a location you desire.
trans-unit.target: **Archived Data Recovery** - You can use Import/Export to have Microsoft transfer large amounts of data stored in Azure Blob Storage to a storage device that you send and then have that device delivered back to a location you desire.

trans-unit.source: Because this will take some time, it's not a good option for disaster recovery.
trans-unit.target: Because this will take some time, it's not a good option for disaster recovery.

trans-unit.source: It's best for archived data that you don't need quick access to.
trans-unit.target: It's best for archived data that you don't need quick access to.

trans-unit.source: File Service
trans-unit.target: File Service

trans-unit.source: ![Azure File Service](./media/fundamentals-introduction-to-azure/FileServiceIntroNew.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure File Service](./media/fundamentals-introduction-to-azure/FileServiceIntroNew.png)

trans-unit.source: Figure: Azure File Services provides SMB \\\\server\share paths for applications running in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Figure: Azure File Services provides SMB \\\\server\share paths for applications running in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: On-premises, it’s common to have large amounts of file storage accessible through the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol using a \\\\Server\share format.
trans-unit.target: On-premises, it’s common to have large amounts of file storage accessible through the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol using a \\\\Server\share format.

trans-unit.source: Azure now has a service that allows you to use this protocol in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Azure now has a service that allows you to use this protocol in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Applications running in Azure can use it to share files between VMs using familiar file system APIs like ReadFile and WriteFile.
trans-unit.target: Applications running in Azure can use it to share files between VMs using familiar file system APIs like ReadFile and WriteFile.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the files can also be accessed at the same time via a REST interface, which allows you to access the shares from on-premises when you also set up a virtual network.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the files can also be accessed at the same time via a REST interface, which allows you to access the shares from on-premises when you also set up a virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Azure Files is built on top of the blob service, so it inherits the same availability, durability, scalability, and geo-redundancy built into Azure Storage.
trans-unit.target: Azure Files is built on top of the blob service, so it inherits the same availability, durability, scalability, and geo-redundancy built into Azure Storage.

trans-unit.source: Scenarios for Azure Files
trans-unit.target: Scenarios for Azure Files

trans-unit.source: **Migrating existing apps to the cloud** - Its easier to migrate on-premises applications to the cloud that use file shares to share data between parts of the application.
trans-unit.target: **Migrating existing apps to the cloud** - Its easier to migrate on-premises applications to the cloud that use file shares to share data between parts of the application.

trans-unit.source: Each VM connects to the file share and then it can read and write files just like it would against an on-premises file share.
trans-unit.target: Each VM connects to the file share and then it can read and write files just like it would against an on-premises file share.

trans-unit.source: **Shared Application Settings** - A common pattern for distributed applications is to have configuration files in a centralized location where they can be accessed from many different virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: **Shared Application Settings** - A common pattern for distributed applications is to have configuration files in a centralized location where they can be accessed from many different virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: These configuration files can be stored in an Azure File share, and read by all application instances.
trans-unit.target: These configuration files can be stored in an Azure File share, and read by all application instances.

trans-unit.source: The settings can also be managed via the REST interface, which allows worldwide access to the configuration files.
trans-unit.target: The settings can also be managed via the REST interface, which allows worldwide access to the configuration files.

trans-unit.source: **Diagnostic Share** - You can save and share diagnostic files like logs, metrics, and crash dumps.
trans-unit.target: **Diagnostic Share** - You can save and share diagnostic files like logs, metrics, and crash dumps.

trans-unit.source: Having these files available through both the SMB and REST interface allows applications to use a variety of analysis tools for processing and analyzing the diagnostic data.
trans-unit.target: Having these files available through both the SMB and REST interface allows applications to use a variety of analysis tools for processing and analyzing the diagnostic data.

trans-unit.source: **Dev/Test/Debug** - When developers or administrators are working on virtual machines in the cloud, they often need a set of tools or utilities.
trans-unit.target: **Dev/Test/Debug** - When developers or administrators are working on virtual machines in the cloud, they often need a set of tools or utilities.

trans-unit.source: Installing and distributing these utilities on each virtual machine is time consuming.
trans-unit.target: Installing and distributing these utilities on each virtual machine is time consuming.

trans-unit.source: With Azure Files, a developer or administrator can store their favorite tools on a file share and connect to them from any virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: With Azure Files, a developer or administrator can store their favorite tools on a file share and connect to them from any virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Networking
trans-unit.target: Networking

trans-unit.source: Azure runs today in many datacenters spread across the world.
trans-unit.target: Azure runs today in many datacenters spread across the world.

trans-unit.source: When you run an application or store data, you can select one or more of these datacenters to use.
trans-unit.target: When you run an application or store data, you can select one or more of these datacenters to use.

trans-unit.source: You can also connect to these datacenters in various ways using the services below.
trans-unit.target: You can also connect to these datacenters in various ways using the services below.

trans-unit.source: Virtual Network
trans-unit.target: Virtual Network

trans-unit.source: VirtualNetwork
trans-unit.target: VirtualNetwork

trans-unit.source: Figure: Virtual Networks provides a private network in the cloud so different services can talk to each other, or to on-premises resources if you set up a VPN connection.a cross-premises connection.
trans-unit.target: Figure: Virtual Networks provides a private network in the cloud so different services can talk to each other, or to on-premises resources if you set up a VPN connection.a cross-premises connection.

trans-unit.source: One useful way to use a public cloud is to treat it as an extension of your own datacenter.
trans-unit.target: One useful way to use a public cloud is to treat it as an extension of your own datacenter.

trans-unit.source: Because you can create VMs on demand, then remove them (and stop paying) when they're no longer needed, you can have computing power only when you want it.
trans-unit.target: Because you can create VMs on demand, then remove them (and stop paying) when they're no longer needed, you can have computing power only when you want it.

trans-unit.source: And since Azure Virtual Machines lets you create VMs running SharePoint, Active Directory, and other familiar on-premises software, this approach can work with the applications you already have.
trans-unit.target: And since Azure Virtual Machines lets you create VMs running SharePoint, Active Directory, and other familiar on-premises software, this approach can work with the applications you already have.

trans-unit.source: To make this really useful, though, your users ought to be able to treat these applications as if they were running in your own datacenter.
trans-unit.target: To make this really useful, though, your users ought to be able to treat these applications as if they were running in your own datacenter.

trans-unit.source: This is exactly what Azure Virtual Network allows.
trans-unit.target: This is exactly what Azure Virtual Network allows.

trans-unit.source: Using a VPN gateway device, an administrator can set up a virtual private network (VPN) between your local network and your VMs that are deployed to a virtual network in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Using a VPN gateway device, an administrator can set up a virtual private network (VPN) between your local network and your VMs that are deployed to a virtual network in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Because you assign your own IP v4 addresses to the cloud VMs, they appear to be on your own network.
trans-unit.target: Because you assign your own IP v4 addresses to the cloud VMs, they appear to be on your own network.

trans-unit.source: Users in your organization can access the applications those VMs contain as if they were running locally.
trans-unit.target: Users in your organization can access the applications those VMs contain as if they were running locally.

trans-unit.source: For more information about planning and creating a virtual network that works for you, see [Virtual Network](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-overview.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about planning and creating a virtual network that works for you, see [Virtual Network](../virtual-network/virtual-networks-overview.md).

trans-unit.source: Express Route
trans-unit.target: Express Route

trans-unit.source: ExpressRoute
trans-unit.target: ExpressRoute

trans-unit.source: Figure: ExpressRoute uses an Azure Virtual Network, but routes connections through faster dedicated lines instead of the public Internet.
trans-unit.target: Figure: ExpressRoute uses an Azure Virtual Network, but routes connections through faster dedicated lines instead of the public Internet.

trans-unit.source: If you need more bandwidth or security than an Azure Virtual Network connection can provide, you can look into ExpressRoute.
trans-unit.target: If you need more bandwidth or security than an Azure Virtual Network connection can provide, you can look into ExpressRoute.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, ExpressRoute can also save you money.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, ExpressRoute can also save you money.

trans-unit.source: You’ll still need a virtual network in Azure, but the link between Azure and your site uses a dedicated connection that does not go over the public Internet.
trans-unit.target: You’ll still need a virtual network in Azure, but the link between Azure and your site uses a dedicated connection that does not go over the public Internet.

trans-unit.source: In order to use this service, you’ll need to have an agreement with either a network service provider, or an exchange provider.
trans-unit.target: In order to use this service, you’ll need to have an agreement with either a network service provider, or an exchange provider.

trans-unit.source: Setting it up an ExpressRoute connection requires more time and planning, so you might want to start with a site-to-site VPN, then migrate to an ExpressRoute connection.
trans-unit.target: Setting it up an ExpressRoute connection requires more time and planning, so you might want to start with a site-to-site VPN, then migrate to an ExpressRoute connection.

trans-unit.source: For more information about ExpressRoute, see [ExpressRoute Technical Overview](../expressroute/expressroute-introduction.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about ExpressRoute, see [ExpressRoute Technical Overview](../expressroute/expressroute-introduction.md).

trans-unit.source: Traffic Manager
trans-unit.target: Traffic Manager

trans-unit.source: TrafficManager
trans-unit.target: TrafficManager

trans-unit.source: Figure : Azure Traffic Manager allows you to route global traffic to your service based on intelligent rules.
trans-unit.target: Figure : Azure Traffic Manager allows you to route global traffic to your service based on intelligent rules.

trans-unit.source: If your Azure application is running in multiple datacenters, you can use Azure Traffic Manager to route requests from users intelligently across instances of the application.
trans-unit.target: If your Azure application is running in multiple datacenters, you can use Azure Traffic Manager to route requests from users intelligently across instances of the application.

trans-unit.source: You can also route traffic to services not running in Azure as long as they are accessible from the internet.
trans-unit.target: You can also route traffic to services not running in Azure as long as they are accessible from the internet.

trans-unit.source: An Azure application with users in just a single part of the world might run in only one Azure datacenter.
trans-unit.target: An Azure application with users in just a single part of the world might run in only one Azure datacenter.

trans-unit.source: An application with users scattered around the world, however, is more likely to run in multiple datacenters, maybe even all of them.
trans-unit.target: An application with users scattered around the world, however, is more likely to run in multiple datacenters, maybe even all of them.

trans-unit.source: In this second situation, you face a problem: How do you intelligently direct users to application instances?
trans-unit.target: In this second situation, you face a problem: How do you intelligently direct users to application instances?

trans-unit.source: Most of the time, you probably want each user to access the datacenter closest to her, since it will likely give her the best response time.
trans-unit.target: Most of the time, you probably want each user to access the datacenter closest to her, since it will likely give her the best response time.

trans-unit.source: But what if that instance of the application is overloaded or unavailable?
trans-unit.target: But what if that instance of the application is overloaded or unavailable?

trans-unit.source: In this case, it would be nice to direct her request automatically to another datacenter.
trans-unit.target: In this case, it would be nice to direct her request automatically to another datacenter.

trans-unit.source: This is exactly what's done by Azure Traffic Manager.
trans-unit.target: This is exactly what's done by Azure Traffic Manager.

trans-unit.source: The owner of an application defines rules that specify how requests from users should be directed to datacenters, then relies on Traffic Manager to carry out these rules.
trans-unit.target: The owner of an application defines rules that specify how requests from users should be directed to datacenters, then relies on Traffic Manager to carry out these rules.

trans-unit.source: For example, users might normally be directed to the closest Azure datacenter, but get sent to another one when the response time from their default datacenter exceeds the response time from other datacenters.
trans-unit.target: For example, users might normally be directed to the closest Azure datacenter, but get sent to another one when the response time from their default datacenter exceeds the response time from other datacenters.

trans-unit.source: For globally distributed applications with many users, having a built-in service to handle problems like these is useful.
trans-unit.target: For globally distributed applications with many users, having a built-in service to handle problems like these is useful.

trans-unit.source: Traffic manager uses Directory Name Service (DNS) to route users to service endpoints, but further traffic does not go through Traffic Manager once that connection is made.
trans-unit.target: Traffic manager uses Directory Name Service (DNS) to route users to service endpoints, but further traffic does not go through Traffic Manager once that connection is made.

trans-unit.source: This keeps Traffic Manager from being a bottleneck that might slow down your service communications.
trans-unit.target: This keeps Traffic Manager from being a bottleneck that might slow down your service communications.

trans-unit.source: Queues
trans-unit.target: Queues

trans-unit.source: Azure Service Bus Relay
trans-unit.target: Azure Service Bus Relay

trans-unit.source: Figure: Queues allow loose coupling between parts of an application and facilitate scaling.
trans-unit.target: Figure: Queues allow loose coupling between parts of an application and facilitate scaling.

trans-unit.source: Queuing is a simple idea: One application places a message in a queue, and that message is eventually read by another application.
trans-unit.target: Queuing is a simple idea: One application places a message in a queue, and that message is eventually read by another application.

trans-unit.source: If your application needs just this straightforward service, Azure Queues might be the best choice.
trans-unit.target: If your application needs just this straightforward service, Azure Queues might be the best choice.

trans-unit.source: Because of the way the Azure grew over time, Azure Storage Queues and Service Bus Queues provide similar queuing services.
trans-unit.target: Because of the way the Azure grew over time, Azure Storage Queues and Service Bus Queues provide similar queuing services.

trans-unit.source: The reasons why you would want to use one over the other are covered in the fairly technical paper [<LINK>](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh767287.aspx "Azure Queues and Service Bus Queues - Compared and Contrasted").
trans-unit.target: The reasons why you would want to use one over the other are covered in the fairly technical paper [<LINK>](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh767287.aspx "Azure Queues and Service Bus Queues - Compared and Contrasted").

trans-unit.source: In many scenarios, either will work.
trans-unit.target: In many scenarios, either will work.

trans-unit.source: Queue Scenarios
trans-unit.target: Queue Scenarios

trans-unit.source: One common use of queues today is to let a web role instance communicate with a worker role instance within the same Cloud Services application.
trans-unit.target: One common use of queues today is to let a web role instance communicate with a worker role instance within the same Cloud Services application.

trans-unit.source: For example, suppose you create an Azure application for video sharing.
trans-unit.target: For example, suppose you create an Azure application for video sharing.

trans-unit.source: The application consists of PHP code running in a web role that lets users upload and watch videos, together with a worker role implemented in C# that translates uploaded video into various formats.
trans-unit.target: The application consists of PHP code running in a web role that lets users upload and watch videos, together with a worker role implemented in C# that translates uploaded video into various formats.

trans-unit.source: When a web role instance gets a new video from a user, it can store the video in a blob, then send a message to a worker role via a queue telling it where to find this new video.
trans-unit.target: When a web role instance gets a new video from a user, it can store the video in a blob, then send a message to a worker role via a queue telling it where to find this new video.

trans-unit.source: A worker role instance-it doesn't matter which one-will then read the message from the queue and carry out the required video translations in the background.
trans-unit.target: A worker role instance-it doesn't matter which one-will then read the message from the queue and carry out the required video translations in the background.

trans-unit.source: Structuring an application in this way allows asynchronous processing, and it also makes the application easier to scale, since the number of web role instances and worker role instances can be varied independently.
trans-unit.target: Structuring an application in this way allows asynchronous processing, and it also makes the application easier to scale, since the number of web role instances and worker role instances can be varied independently.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the queue size as a trigger to scale the number of worker roles up and down.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the queue size as a trigger to scale the number of worker roles up and down.

trans-unit.source: Too high, and you add more roles.
trans-unit.target: Too high, and you add more roles.

trans-unit.source: When it gets lower, you can reduce the number of running roles to save money.
trans-unit.target: When it gets lower, you can reduce the number of running roles to save money.

trans-unit.source: You can use this same pattern between many different parts of your application even if they don't use web and worker roles.
trans-unit.target: You can use this same pattern between many different parts of your application even if they don't use web and worker roles.

trans-unit.source: It allows you to scale the parts on either side of the queue up and down as demand and processing time requires.
trans-unit.target: It allows you to scale the parts on either side of the queue up and down as demand and processing time requires.

trans-unit.source: For many years, the bulk of data analysis has been done on relational data stored in a data warehouse built with a relational DBMS.

trans-unit.source: This kind of business analytics is still important, and it will be for a long time to come.

trans-unit.source: But what if the data you want to analyze is so big that relational databases just can't handle it?
trans-unit.target: But what if the data you want to analyze is so big that relational databases just can't handle it?

trans-unit.source: And suppose the data isn't relational?
trans-unit.target: And suppose the data isn't relational?

trans-unit.target: It might be server logs in a datacenter, for example, or historical event data from sensors, or something else.

trans-unit.target: In cases like this, you have what's known as a big data problem.

trans-unit.target: You need another approach.

trans-unit.source: The dominant technology today for analyzing big data is Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: The dominant technology today for analyzing big data is Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: An Apache open source project, this technology stores data using the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS), then lets developers create MapReduce jobs to analyze that data.
trans-unit.target: An Apache open source project, this technology stores data using the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS), then lets developers create MapReduce jobs to analyze that data.

trans-unit.source: HDFS spreads data across multiple servers, then runs chunks of the MapReduce job on each one, letting the big data be processed in parallel.
trans-unit.target: HDFS spreads data across multiple servers, then runs chunks of the MapReduce job on each one, letting the big data be processed in parallel.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight is the name of the Azure's Apache Hadoop-based service.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight is the name of the Azure's Apache Hadoop-based service.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight lets HDFS store data on the cluster and distribute it across multiple VMs.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight lets HDFS store data on the cluster and distribute it across multiple VMs.

trans-unit.source: It also spreads the logic of a MapReduce job across those VMs.
trans-unit.target: It also spreads the logic of a MapReduce job across those VMs.

trans-unit.source: Just as with on-premises Hadoop, data is processed locally-the logic and the data it works on are in the same VM-and in parallel for better performance.
trans-unit.target: Just as with on-premises Hadoop, data is processed locally-the logic and the data it works on are in the same VM-and in parallel for better performance.

trans-unit.source: HDInsight can also store data in Azure Storage Vault (ASV), which uses blobs.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight can also store data in Azure Storage Vault (ASV), which uses blobs.

trans-unit.source: Using ASV allows you to save money because you can delete your HDInsight cluster when not in use, but still keep your data in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Using ASV allows you to save money because you can delete your HDInsight cluster when not in use, but still keep your data in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: One of the most attractive ways to use a cloud platform is to run high performance computing (HPC) and other "Big Compute" applications.
trans-unit.target: One of the most attractive ways to use a cloud platform is to run high performance computing (HPC) and other "Big Compute" applications.

trans-unit.source: Examples include specialized engineering applications built to use the industry-standard Message Passing Interface (MPI) as well as so-called embarrassingly parallel applications, such financial risk models.
trans-unit.target: Examples include specialized engineering applications built to use the industry-standard Message Passing Interface (MPI) as well as so-called embarrassingly parallel applications, such financial risk models.

trans-unit.source: The essence of Big Compute is executing code on many machines at the same time.
trans-unit.target: The essence of Big Compute is executing code on many machines at the same time.

trans-unit.source: On Azure, this means running many virtual machines simultaneously, all working in parallel to solve some problem.
trans-unit.target: On Azure, this means running many virtual machines simultaneously, all working in parallel to solve some problem.

trans-unit.source: Doing this requires some way to resources and to schedule applications, i.e., to distribute their work across these instances.
trans-unit.target: Doing this requires some way to resources and to schedule applications, i.e., to distribute their work across these instances.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft’s free HPC Pack and other compute cluster solutions can perform well in Azure, taking advantage of Azure compute and infrastructure services to add capacity on-demand to an on-premises compute cluster or run Big Compute applications entirely in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft’s free HPC Pack and other compute cluster solutions can perform well in Azure, taking advantage of Azure compute and infrastructure services to add capacity on-demand to an on-premises compute cluster or run Big Compute applications entirely in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: Azure provides a range of VM instance sizes with different configurations of CPU cores, memory, disk capacity, and other characteristics to meet the requirements of different applications.
trans-unit.target: Azure provides a range of VM instance sizes with different configurations of CPU cores, memory, disk capacity, and other characteristics to meet the requirements of different applications.

trans-unit.source: The recently introduced A8 and A9 instances work well for many compute intensive workloads, and parallel MPI applications in particular, because they have high speed, multicore CPUs and large amounts of memory.
trans-unit.target: The recently introduced A8 and A9 instances work well for many compute intensive workloads, and parallel MPI applications in particular, because they have high speed, multicore CPUs and large amounts of memory.

trans-unit.source: In certain configurations the instances take advantage of a low-latency and high-throughput application network in the cloud that includes remote direct memory access (RDMA) technology for maximum efficiency of parallel MPI applications.
trans-unit.target: In certain configurations the instances take advantage of a low-latency and high-throughput application network in the cloud that includes remote direct memory access (RDMA) technology for maximum efficiency of parallel MPI applications.

trans-unit.source: Azure also offers Big Compute application developers and partners a full set of compute capabilities, services, architecture choices, and development tools.
trans-unit.target: Azure also offers Big Compute application developers and partners a full set of compute capabilities, services, architecture choices, and development tools.

trans-unit.source: Azure supports custom Big Compute workflows involving specialized data workflows and job and task scheduling patterns that can scale to thousands of compute cores.
trans-unit.target: Azure supports custom Big Compute workflows involving specialized data workflows and job and task scheduling patterns that can scale to thousands of compute cores.

trans-unit.source: Media
trans-unit.target: Media

trans-unit.source: ![Azure Media Services](./media/fundamentals-introduction-to-azure/MediaServicesIntroNew.png)
trans-unit.target: ![Azure Media Services](./media/fundamentals-introduction-to-azure/MediaServicesIntroNew.png)

trans-unit.source: Figure: Media Services is a platform for applications that provide video and other media to clients around the world.
trans-unit.target: Figure: Media Services is a platform for applications that provide video and other media to clients around the world.

trans-unit.source: Video makes up a large part of Internet traffic today, and that percentage will be even larger tomorrow.
trans-unit.target: Video makes up a large part of Internet traffic today, and that percentage will be even larger tomorrow.

trans-unit.source: Yet providing video on the web isn't simple.
trans-unit.target: Yet providing video on the web isn't simple.

trans-unit.source: There are lots of variables, such as the encoding algorithm and the display resolution of the user's screen.
trans-unit.target: There are lots of variables, such as the encoding algorithm and the display resolution of the user's screen.

trans-unit.source: Video also tends to have bursts in demand, like a Saturday night spike when lots of people decide they'd like to watch an online movie.
trans-unit.target: Video also tends to have bursts in demand, like a Saturday night spike when lots of people decide they'd like to watch an online movie.

trans-unit.source: Given its popularity, it's a safe bet that many new applications will be created that use video.
trans-unit.target: Given its popularity, it's a safe bet that many new applications will be created that use video.

trans-unit.source: Yet all of them will need to solve some of the same problems, and making each one solve those problems on its own makes no sense.
trans-unit.target: Yet all of them will need to solve some of the same problems, and making each one solve those problems on its own makes no sense.

trans-unit.source: A better approach is to create a platform that provides common solutions for many applications to use.
trans-unit.target: A better approach is to create a platform that provides common solutions for many applications to use.

trans-unit.source: And building this platform in the cloud has some clear advantages.
trans-unit.target: And building this platform in the cloud has some clear advantages.

trans-unit.source: It can be broadly available on a pay-as-you-go basis, and it can also handle the variability in demand that video applications often face.
trans-unit.target: It can be broadly available on a pay-as-you-go basis, and it can also handle the variability in demand that video applications often face.

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services addresses this problem.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services addresses this problem.

trans-unit.source: It provides a set of cloud components that make life easier for people creating and running applications using video and other media.
trans-unit.target: It provides a set of cloud components that make life easier for people creating and running applications using video and other media.

trans-unit.source: As the figure shows, Media Services provides a set of components for applications that work with video and other media.
trans-unit.target: As the figure shows, Media Services provides a set of components for applications that work with video and other media.

trans-unit.source: For example, it includes a media ingest component to upload video into Media Services (where it's stored in Azure Blobs), an encoding component that supports various video and audio formats, a content protection component that provides digital rights management, a component for inserting ads into a video stream, components for streaming, and more.
trans-unit.target: For example, it includes a media ingest component to upload video into Media Services (where it's stored in Azure Blobs), an encoding component that supports various video and audio formats, a content protection component that provides digital rights management, a component for inserting ads into a video stream, components for streaming, and more.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft partners can also provide components for the platform, then have Microsoft distribute those components and bill on their behalf.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft partners can also provide components for the platform, then have Microsoft distribute those components and bill on their behalf.

trans-unit.source: Applications that use this platform can run on Azure or elsewhere.
trans-unit.target: Applications that use this platform can run on Azure or elsewhere.

trans-unit.source: For example, a desktop application for a video production house might let its users upload video to Media Services, then process it in various ways.
trans-unit.target: For example, a desktop application for a video production house might let its users upload video to Media Services, then process it in various ways.

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, a cloud-based content management service running on Azure might rely on Media Services to process and distribute video.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, a cloud-based content management service running on Azure might rely on Media Services to process and distribute video.

trans-unit.source: Wherever it runs and whatever it does, each application chooses which components it needs to use, accessing them through RESTful interfaces.
trans-unit.target: Wherever it runs and whatever it does, each application chooses which components it needs to use, accessing them through RESTful interfaces.

trans-unit.source: To distribute what it produces, an application can use the Azure CDN, another CDN, or just send bits directly to users.
trans-unit.target: To distribute what it produces, an application can use the Azure CDN, another CDN, or just send bits directly to users.

trans-unit.source: However it gets there, video created using Media Services can be consumed by various client systems, including Windows, Macintosh, HTML 5, iOS, Android, Windows Phone, Flash, and Silverlight.
trans-unit.target: However it gets there, video created using Media Services can be consumed by various client systems, including Windows, Macintosh, HTML 5, iOS, Android, Windows Phone, Flash, and Silverlight.

trans-unit.source: The goal is to make it easier to create modern media applications.
trans-unit.target: The goal is to make it easier to create modern media applications.
